*div1 type="summary"* *p*Nicholas Clopper to Austin, September 16, 1826. Judicial procedure. Suit for debt. Enclosures.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*To the *person_mentioned*Honble Judge Austin*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*The petition of *person_mentioned*Nicholas Clopper*/person_mentioned*, at *location_mentioned*San felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="09-16-1826">16 Septr 1826*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*Humbly sheweth, that in a decision (filed in your *location_mentioned*office*/location_mentioned*) had before*person_mentioned* M. B. Nuckols Esq Alcalde of the *location_mentioned*D. S. F. de Austin*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* wherein *person_mentioned*C. G. Alsbury*/person_mentioned* was pit if and your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*deft your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*is of opinion, that very great Injustice has been done him and therefore prays relief from your honor.*/p*
*p*It will appear that the Judgt render'd in the Case aforsaid by the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*is for Seventy Three Dollars and fifty Cents, in Land or Cattle. Now your Honor will perceive that by a true statement of accote between *person_mentioned*Alsbury */person_mentioned*and your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*a considerable amot see statement No 1 hereto annexed which he unjustly detains to the great damage and loss of your *person_mentioned*petitioner*/person_mentioned*, and when your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*agreed to let the said *person_mentioned*Alsbury */person_mentioned*have two Cows and Calves from *person_mentioned*Capt Christman*/person_mentioned*, it was for the express purpose of paying for a Bay Mare which your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*had contracted for with *person_mentioned*Mr. Hollyman*/person_mentioned*, and the said *person_mentioned*Alsbury */person_mentioned*wrote a Letter to your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*stating that the reason he did not get the mare was that she had a young Colt and supposed she would not suit whereas your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*saw *person_mentioned*Mr Hollyman*/person_mentioned* after receiving *person_mentioned*Alsbury*/person_mentioned*s Letter and *person_mentioned*Mr H*/person_mentioned* said that it was not true the mare had not a Colt, nor had*person_mentioned* Mr A*/person_mentioned* said anything to him about the mare from which circumstances with others your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*is apprehensive that said *person_mentioned*Alsbury */person_mentioned*is endeavouring to defraud him, for as late as the *date_mentioned n="09-07-1826">7th day of the present month*/date_mentioned*, the said *person_mentioned*Alsbury */person_mentioned*told your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*that he had Cattle intended for your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*in the hands of *person_mentioned*Wm. Robins,*/person_mentioned* but your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*now doubting the truth of this assertion made it his business to see *person_mentioned*Mr Robins*/person_mentioned* who said that there was no contract between him and *person_mentioned*Alsbury */person_mentioned*nor any prospect of one, and that he had no Cattle to deliver to said *person_mentioned*Alsbury*/person_mentioned*, or his order, this circumstance again excited strong suspicions in the mind of your *person_mentioned*petitioner*/person_mentioned*, that the said *person_mentioned*Alsbury */person_mentioned*intended a fraud—Your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*wishes not to withhold any thing that is due from him to another, and prays that you will set aside the Judgt—aforesaid, which he doubts not you will at once see to be Erroneous; and will direct such proceedings as that Justice may be done to both *person_mentioned*parties*/person_mentioned* —and that your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*may be secured in his just Rights.*/p*
*p*And in duty bound, will ever pray*/p*
*p*(Signed) *person_mentioned*N. Clopper*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*I do hereby Certify that *person_mentioned*C. G. Alsbury*/person_mentioned* Received from me an ordr to *person_mentioned*Esqr Harris*/person_mentioned* for four Cows and Calves two of which was on accot of *person_mentioned*N. Clopper*/person_mentioned* and two, on acct of *person_mentioned*J. C. Ludlow*/person_mentioned* in Testimony whereof I have herewith set my hand *date_mentioned n="09-xx-1826">Septr 1826*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*(Signed) *person_mentioned*Horatio Chriesman*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*STATEMENT NO. 1*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*C. G. Alsbury*/person_mentioned* */p* *p*To *person_mentioned*Nicholas CLopper Dr*/person_mentioned*.*/p* *p**date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1826">1826*/date_mentioned**/p*
